intro: Sinarundinaria qinlingensis, commonly known as Qinling bamboo, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Qinling Mountains of China. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender culms and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant exhibits a clumping growth habit and is adapted to the cool, moist climates of its mountainous habitat. Its botanical features make it an important subject for studies on plant evolution and biodiversity in temperate regions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological sensitivity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
